p:
Our results show that the presence of wMel strain of Wolbachia in mosquitoes has the potential to greatly reduce the transmission potential of Ae. aegypti for YFV. It is important for public health agencies of arbovirus endemic countries to have constant awareness of the potential of Ae. aegypti to become an urban vector for Yellow fever virus once again
6, 47 . If that becomes reality, Wolbachia-infected mosquitoes could be a powerful tool for YFV control, along with the currently applied vaccination program
10, 48 .
